docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 11 -- There were strong indications today at the Inter-American economic conference that Cuba might sign the Alliance for Progress agreement. The possibility posed a tactical problem for the United States.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Aug. 12 -- The Cuban Government charged today that a large stock of arms had been transferred from the United States naval base at Guantanamo to the anti-Castro underground in Santiago.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Aug. 12 -- The Cuban Government charged today that a large stock of arms had been transferred from the United States naval base at Guantanamo to the anti-Castro underground in Santiago.
docs.abstract: Govt charges that Guantanamo base aides helped transfer arms to anti-Castro underground, Santiago; charges arms were meant for attempt on R Castro and to simulate attack on base as excuse for armed intervention; widespread arrests reptd; L Ponce reptdly led plot; Capt Schoenweiss, ex-base comdr, allegedly involved

headline.main: U.S. BASE AIDED PLOT, CUBA SAYS; Charges Guantanamo Gave Arms to Kill Raul Castro

byline.original: By RICHARD EDER Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 12 -- The inter-American Alliance for Progress meeting hastened toward final agreement today with an assist from the United States Senate.
docs.lead_paragraph: PUNTA DEL ESTE, Uruguay, Aug. 12 -- The inter-American Alliance for Progress meeting hastened toward final agreement today with an assist from the United States Senate.
docs.abstract: Alliance aided by US Sen defeat of amendment that would have removed long-term borrowing authority from Kennedy's foreign-aid bill; Dillon pleased; vote answers doubt raised by Guevara on US promises of funds which frequently are not ratified by Cong; com drafting Alliance agreement compromises on 9-man com of experts; members to be nominated by IBRD, ECLA and OAS Econ and Soc Council; US agrees to request of 3 nations to write into agreement pledge to take prompt action on applications for emergency aid; AFL-CIO vp W Doherty urges watch be kept on Alliance to insure it does not merely make rich richer and poor poorer

headline.main: Senate Vote on Aid Spurs Latin Parley; SENATE VOTE AIDS AMERICAS PARLEY

docs.snippet: A Swiss investment and banking group has announced the establishment of a private bank in Panama, Banco Suizo Panamericano, with an initial capitalization of $1,000,000. It will be headed by Dr. Manuel Cisneros, former Foreign Minister of Peru.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Swiss investment and banking group has announced the establishment of a private bank in Panama, Banco Suizo Panamericano, with an initial capitalization of $1,000,000. It will be headed by Dr. Manuel Cisneros, former Foreign Minister of Peru.
docs.abstract: Private bank formed by Swiss interests
